website_summaries.verdict: This inflatable travel pillow includes a washable cover and folds into a nice compact size when not in use.
pros: You can adjust the fill level to your comfort
Washable cover comes with a soft layer of batting for comfort
cons: At 15" inflated, this pillow does not have as much length as other camping pillows

customer_reviews.title: Never thought I'd find an inflatable pillow I'd like for backpacking...
customer_reviews.text: I have always been skeptical of the comfort of inflatable pillows, and for backpacking trips, have relied on heavier travel pillows or just rolling up clothing to serve as a pillow. This pillow, however, has changed my mind. The shape of the inflated pillow makes for a comfortable sleep, and it's fairly easy to inflate/deflate. I'd say the one complaint is folding it back into its compartment effectively (much like backpacking sleeping bags, which seem impossible to fold). However, I think I will buy this product again for a few friends. I actually slept well with this pillow, which I was not expecting!
customer_reviews.author: BPowell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: I took this pillow with me on a trip with limited packing space. Of course, it never packs as small after you first use it, but it is still super compact. I blew it up once and it lasted me 4 days without needing to be inflated (may have lasted longer but I had to pack it back down). You can control the firmness level to your liking, which is a huge bonus. I would highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow for long trips
customer_reviews.text: This little pillow is amazingly comfortable. I love that it can be inflated to any degree of firmness - a little more for a headrest, less for lumbar cushioning in an otherwise uncomfortable seat. I have back issues, and this little treasure has totally transformed my driving/passenger situation, especially on longer trips. I don't think I'll ever spend time in a car without it from now on.
customer_reviews.author: simple logic

customer_reviews.title: After being really disappointed with the Klymit brand pillow
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for about a month now as a pillow for my back while driving, and have found it to hold air with no noticeable loss. After being really disappointed with the Klymit brand pillow, the Rikki Tikki pillow is a pleasant change.It is light weight and I will be using it on a trip I plan where weight needs to be kept at a minimum. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Houck

customer_reviews.title: Like the larger size
customer_reviews.text: Used nightly instead of regular pillow to relieve arthritic neck pain. Small one purchased at a local drugstore works very well but wanted a larger size. Glad to have found this one on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Linda jw

customer_reviews.title: Liked this so much that I bought 2!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I ordered this travel pillow! It is easy to inflate and deflate with a much easier system to do both. I like that it stays inflated to whatever level I like. My only wish is that the little bag that is attached for storage was slightly larger. It is a little difficult to get back in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mel's Notes

customer_reviews.title: You can't wash the cover
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to be able to wash the cover but it has a layer of batting (pillow fluff) on the inside that would fall apart in the wash. The layer of batting adds a soft feel that is nice but it needs one more layer of fabric on the inside to protect it. The pillow itself seemed surprisingly thin for how great the reviews are and I felt like I could tear a hole while trying to unplug the air hole. It has a Velcro closure on the back that allows for tucking in the attached bag, which is nice!
customer_reviews.author: Corey Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but moldy.
customer_reviews.text: Well they are nice to use, easy to store when traveling on a motorcycle and can’t pack real pillows. Don’t take up much space, the bag is attached so super easy. Can inflate all the way up or let some air out to be comfier in my opinion.. BUT they grow mold like CRAZY from blowing them up. We used for a weekend trip and BAM mold. Lots and lots of Mold. We deflated them, let them sit for probably couple minutes and rolled up, packed away, and headed home. Got home and wow wow wow. The mold is everywhere and smells so bad. If they didn’t grow mold like that, I’d give 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michellci B.

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good with a few minuses
customer_reviews.text: The good: This pillow is very easy to inflate and once inflated, stays that way. It gives nice firm support. It packs up very compactly which is great for backcountry camping or air travel. The bad: I know it's a travel pillow but it is pretty small. A few inches larger on either side would have increased my comfort a lot. The pillow material is also a bit slick and tends to slide around on a sleeping bag, making it hard to position the pillow for a good night sleep, and possibly disturbing your sleeping companions. I still would recommend this pillow overall but it's just not *quite* perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Christina M

customer_reviews.title: Compact lightweight inflatable pillow perfect for backpacking or traveling
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is very compact, lightweight and comfortable! I liked the blow up design, but snapping the seal into place can be a little tricky! Once you get the hang of it, it’s easy. The color is great. I wish I had this pillow on my last backpacking trip, would’ve lightened my load!! Would definitely recommend and the price is great. My only advice: add instructions as it’s not as straightforward as you may think!
customer_reviews.author: Justine McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Supportive Camping Pillow For All Sleeping Types
customer_reviews.text: I'm a side sleeper and was looking for a camping pillow with more support than the other camping pillows that cater more to back sleepers. The Rikki Tikki camping pillow supports all sleeping types by not having an "indentation" in the middle of the pillow for head support (which only supports back sleepers appropriately). The cloth outside makes it comfortable and it is very easy to inflate and deflate. The last bonus is that it comes with its own compression sack which is attached to the pillow itself and compresses the pillow down to the sizes of your hand. Excellent design, affordability, and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Eric DIY

customer_reviews.title: Had a problem with the pillow but the company took care of it.
customer_reviews.text: So sad about this pillow. I filled it up before our 5 day hike and it inflated properly. However one night on the trails and deflated in less than a couple of hours. I missed the return window. *Update: After my review the company reached out to me and gave me a refund with an apology. Great customer service. So I am happy to change my review from 1 to 4 stars. So glad that they care about their customers in that way.
customer_reviews.author: C. Welty

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfy Travel Pillow!
customer_reviews.text: This travel pillow was perfect for me. I recently was on a trip and used it on the airplane. There is a port on the back side of the pillow that allows you to inflate it within 3-5 breaths. You can adjust the softness of the pillow based on that. It was lined with a cotton liner to give it some extra cushion, which always helps for long periods of rest. The only thing that I would say was troublesome, was deflating. I couldn’t get the pillow completely deflated because the port for inflating has a seal to keep air in. Other than that, it’s a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nadi

customer_reviews.title: Very small and light perfect for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a camping trip. The only thing I was missing last time I went was a pillow. I bought this one because it's small and light. It's a good pillow but I can't say it's the most supportive. The shape is OK but it could be better, however it's small and light and good enough to handle a few nights out in a tent backpacking. Other than that though it's perfect. I would recommend it as it is pretty cheap and light. To be fair this is the first inflatable pillow I have used. If they were very supportive then people would use them everyday. It's still very small and light and perfect for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Geeked Out Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Pillow
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent pillow for camping, traveling and even for special use at home. It is easy to inflate and comes with its own, attached storage pouch. The only drawback with this pouch it trying to remember how to properly fold the pillow to get it back into that pouch...a minor drawback that a simple instruction sheet might fix. I personally liked keeping it more in its flat state (not rolled/folded back into that pouch) for placement in my suitcase. It doesn't take up much room, but even less when stored flat.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This pillow will BLOW your mind!
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome...so awesome that I bought a 2nd pillow and I bring both with me when I travel. I use one to support my lower back and one to support my head when I want to get some sleep on a plane, train, or automobile. I'm someone who struggles to get comfortable when I travel but this inflatable pillow has made traveling much nicer. - Easy to inflate, deflate, and pack up when you're done - small and easy to pack - can be inflated to any size you desire - if you like it firm, give it a full blow; if you like it soft, give it a 1/2 or 2/3 blow to achieve partial inflation
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Whoa this pillow is not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: So I opened the package and saw that the pillow was very small, about the size of a 4 oz fuel canister (I'm using this for backpacking). I found the nozzle and was excited that it matched with my inflation pouch that I use for my air mattress, however I didn't need to use it. It inflated with three breaths. Then, the cover on it has tension in such a way as it cradles your head, and puts some space between your head and the actual pillow! It's great, I'm buying a second one for my partner. I haven't yet used it on a trip, but the unboxing was so satisfying that I had to review it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless after six uses
customer_reviews.text: The plastic air bag inside the pillow cloth bag has a pin hole leak right on the seam near the valve where one blows the pillow up. The location makes it impossible to patch so the air bag is worthless. So far RikkiTikki has not responded for my request for a replacement air bag. Do not waste your money on an item that has a very limited return time frame.
customer_reviews.author: Semyon Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backpacking!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a 3 day 2 night backpacking trip! While the rest of my body was in pain from my 30 pound pack and difficult terrain, I had ZERO NECK PAIN after sleeping on this pillow!!! The cover makes a huge difference. It is so soft feeling. You can inflate or deflate for comfort. There is also an indent In The middle for your head! Does not feel like your sleeping on something that’s inflated. So glad I purchased this last minute!!!
customer_reviews.author: NCleidomastoid

customer_reviews.title: Yes, yes yes — Saved my butt!
customer_reviews.text: Took this pillow to the wilds of Panama and the Darién gap. I have bad hip and weight and over 210 pounds. Although this is marketed as a head pillow, if you just inflate it slightly with a couple of breaths it works excellently as a cushion on long flights, driving your car or under your butt when sleeping on unforgiving surfaces. Best of all it deflates completely for packing and weighs nothing. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: EarlyXmas

customer_reviews.title: East to inflate but requires some efforts to totally deflate
customer_reviews.text: I like this pillow because it has the cotton surface that gives the sleeper a softer and warm touch. It is easy to inflate like my other camp pillow. I also like the design that the pouch or bag is attached to the pillow case. However, it is not so easy to completely deflate to the point that it can be wrapped into the attached pouch. I think, after few more chances to practice, it may become easier.
customer_reviews.author: Yee H Shuai

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T HOLD AIR
customer_reviews.text: Simply put: this has a shoddy valve, similar to a cheap swimming pool raft, and all the air leaks out of it in about 20 minutes -- long enough that testing it at home is fine, but actually camping is not. (I tried re-inflating and resealing several times. I suggest you get one with a higher-end inflation valve!) UPDATE: I contacted the seller about this, and even though it was past the return window on Amazon, they issued me a refund without complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: The size of the pillow is perfect - however
customer_reviews.text: The size of the pillow is perfect - however, it only held air for less than 7 minutes. Going back tomorrow. It didn't even hold the air from the kitchen counter to the backyard lounge chair. So, I blew it up again, thinking maybe I did something wrong. Nope - under 7 minutes and it was flat. Tried that twice. Folded towel will work just as well. Back it goes for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Miller

customer_reviews.title: camping pillow
customer_reviews.text: When my husband and I got back into backpacking and camping we needed some new equipment. My husband bought an inflatable pillow but I didn't think it was worth the money. Well, I was wrong. I just couln't get comfortable. I purchased this pillow after reading reviews. It's always hard to know from a picture. I am pleased with the product. It took a few tries to get it back in the bag but I do like that the bag is attached. My husband tends to lose his loose bag in the tent. It seems a little larger than pictured or my hand is a lot smaller than in the picture but still small enough to tuck in my pack.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: My number one travel item
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a pillow for a flight to Denver, my back did not hurt for the first time in years. Then I used it for lumbar support for the long drive to our destination, then for the next four nights I used it for a pillow, their pillows were very thin and uncomfortable. I will never be without this Fantastic pillow whenever I travel, sincerely. :)
customer_reviews.author: Barberbrown

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this product! I didn't know what to expect, since I've never needed to use an inflatable pillow, I thought it might just feel like resting your head on an inflatable pool float or something, but the RikkiTikki travel pillow is super comfortable and soft. I also like that the clasp has an extra flap that does a really good job of keeping air in. Overall, I'm really happy with the quality of this product!
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: great pillow with a tiny packing footprint
customer_reviews.text: I bought a ton of gear for a 4 day 3 night trip down the delware water gap I sleep on my side, and due to back issues and all, I always keep a pillow between my legs keeps my top leg elevated and my spine from twisting this lil fella blew up fast, easy and simple to pack and it takes up practically zero space its comfortable and does the job!!!!
customer_reviews.author: John C. Parks

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Disliked the fact they said it will take no more than 3 or 4 deep breaths. HMMM! They stated: RELIABLE and EASY to USE: the camp pillow has a reliable valve, which doesn’t let the air escape. It’s is easy to use – you will be able to inflate the backpack pillow with just 3-4 deep breaths. How about after 10 breaths, it was half inflated.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Stravitz

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to my camping gear. I tend to sleep in made shelters or small tents for backpacking and Scouting. This was a great luxury for me, small compact, and comfortable. As you can see this is past tense. Why you might ask? Well my lovely husky, Mikasa, decided that she loved it more as a chew toy after I got back from a trip today. So now I will have to order a new one.
customer_reviews.author: 7ft Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Great travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: I use a small pillow between my knees of a night. This worked great on my recent cruise. It is small and inflates to your liking. It stayed inflated the entire time. One side is slightly brushed the other nylon type material. To delete I just pulled the plug and it deflated on its own. Was a little hard to get out of the travel bag and probably will not put it back in. I recommend for a small travel pillow.
customer_reviews.author: anomyous

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Easy to pack away. The attached storage bag is a streak of genius. The only downside is the “ backside” is smooth. It slides against your sleeping bag so it slips out from under your head. If you flip it over it won’t slide but you are laying on the side with the valve. My solution is to use a small pillow case. Other than this a great product.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Won’t hold air for more than 15min.
customer_reviews.text: This pillow had potential. It could not hold air. Would fill it with air and the 10-15min later it’s deflated. Total waste
customer_reviews.author: JBSweet

customer_reviews.title: Versatile.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not as soft and comfortable as a regular pillow, but for traveling it’s great to have. It is very easy to fold up and put into its attached bag, which makes it very small. I don’t like it fully inflated, but when partially so it can be used for your back on a plane since it molds to you. I use it mainly for my knees while sleeping at night and easy to pack in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Elma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Backpacking Pillow.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't look thick in the product images, but it actually is pretty thick when blown up, which is what I want for support. A little short on the length if you have a big head, but it easily compacts into itself with the attached bag, making it great for backpacking. The soft material doesn't make a lot of noise on your ear and it is comfortable to lay on. Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dysnomia

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: Super compact and portable. Good build quality, with a sturdy air plug and soft outer lining. I haven't used as a pillow too much, though it felt pretty comfortable when I tried it out. I did use it to SIT on during a 13 hour flight to Asia, where I get sore in the seats after hours, and it did great. No loss of air that I could tell (at about half inflation). Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and support
customer_reviews.text: I have a very hard time being comfortable in bed despite the memory foam mattress and many pillows because of hip bursitis. I dread traveling because I can't bring my bed and pillows with me. This item is compact and inflates with 6 puffs. It makes resting comfortably possible so I will be ordering another one.
customer_reviews.author: CuperLady

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Pillow Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best travel pillow I’ve ever used! I love that it rolls up so little, it fits in the side pocket of my backpack, and it doesn’t lose air once it’s inflated! The pillow case is super soft too! I’m definitely recommending this pillow to my travel friends!
customer_reviews.author: ThisBlondesOyster

customer_reviews.title: I really like it
customer_reviews.text: It will inflate easily and has a flap that closes when you remove your mouth, so the air does not all rush out when you stop blowing. It seems to be more comfortable if you do not blow it up so it is tight. It is a bit of a pain to get back in the bag but it will go if you stop and take a moment to think about how to pack it.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Mazeiko

customer_reviews.title: Nice travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow for camping because it is so compact. It's not a bad pillow however it could be just a little larger. It's easy to inflate and deflate. It can be made just as firm as you would like yet can be inflated just a little if you want. Good pillow if your like me and take minimal equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Huggy

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pillow for hiking/camping activities. It deflates and rolls into a very small pouch and takes up a very small amount of space in my pack. If you are in need of a small hiking pillow this will do the trick. I've used it on several trips to date and it is holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: CGP

customer_reviews.title: Love this traveling pillow!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pillow. Used it while sleeping in my sleeping bag. It’s portable and easy to carry. This pillow would not work if you’re traveling in a car or plane, unless you are laying down completely. I thought I would try but it didn’t support my neck well. It does work how you’re supposed to use it- like a regular pillow.
customer_reviews.author: De3

customer_reviews.title: Not right for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product but found myself fumbling around with it every time i used it. Hard to deflate and get back into pouch. Have to separate the plastic and fabric to make this happen. Also the fabric is very warm. Great fro cold but not for hot. Made my head sweat every time I used it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My family fights over this pillow.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a number of pillows for my family to backpack and camp this summer. This is by far the best one we purchased. The others slide much more frequently from your head. This works well for side sleepers as well. The storage bag is easy to use to repack the pillow. My 5 year old can get it repacked.
customer_reviews.author: Cincinnati momma

customer_reviews.title: Small, but still comfy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for tent camping and the size was perfect, both folded up and inflated. The only thing that separated it from being a 5 star product was that the underside fabric is slick, which made it slip around. This would be perfect if it had some sort of fabric with a little grip or even Terry like the other side.
customer_reviews.author: msmccorm

customer_reviews.title: My son just used this on a backpacking trip...
customer_reviews.text: ...and he told that me one of his tent-mates said he was a bit jealous of it. I was told that it was very comfortable, and along with the inflatable mattress he also got for the trip, allowed for truly excellent sleep. When it didn't rain, that is. But that probably wasn't the pillow's fault.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Harris

customer_reviews.title: Works very well as back support for driving.
customer_reviews.text: I use this pillow as a back support in the car. Because it is air filled, it moves and works much better for me than the 3 other back supports I have purchased in the past. I have less back pain while driving and am not as stiff when I get out of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Pillow Lasted only two nights
customer_reviews.text: Loved the pillow the first two nights, however unfortunately it developed a leak and is now leaking. only lasted two nights backpacking. was only used on a sleeping pad inside my tent. It states their is a "lifetime guarantee." I was able to contact the seller of my order and they sent me a new pillow no questions asked and arrived in two days! It's promising to see they stand behind their Gaurantee. Can't wait to use the pillow again and hoping this one lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: I love how small it can roll up, perfect for camping. very comfortable and the soft cloth helps prevent your head from sliding off like other inflatable pillows. It took a few puffs to inflate and you were all set. Medium size pillow perfect for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Nancecas

customer_reviews.title: it would work well for camping
customer_reviews.text: but didn't suit my purposes as a lumbar support pillow on a plane - it was way too big, no matter how much or little I inflated it. Also, the opening to inflate it with is large and made for a pump, not your mouth. It's a small enough pillow that being able to easily blow it up with your mouth would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: NMW

customer_reviews.title: Good, but costly
customer_reviews.text: My rating is actually 3.5 stars... it’s quite pricey for what it’s made out of. But so far, the functionality and design are good. It packs down really small, so makes it very portable for travel. And you can adjust firmness with the amount of air you put in. I would take away 1 star for price and half a star for manual inflation.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Just as Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Soft cotton on face. Adjustability makes it very comfortable. Exterior seems very durable. The air bag material is a little thin, that probably adds to the comfort. Only tested around the house so far. Heading from US to Asia soon will update if anything interesting to report after the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Educated Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to inflate/deflate
customer_reviews.text: Packs extremely small and easy to inflate/deflate. It's not the most comfortable of pillows (I'd suggest not inflating ALL the way) but it gets the job done! It's a bit on the small side. I do put a pillowcase over it just to keep the cover clean.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great travelling pillow
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for travelling. It's insanely easy to inflate and lost little to no air during use. My only complaint is that no matter how much I try I can't get all the air out of it so it makes it a little more difficult to bundle it up back in the pouch
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Nice pillow, but won't hold air
customer_reviews.text: Specific use for this pillow was backpacking. Had a nice covering on top and after the air bladder would not hold air pressure from the start, I folded up my down jacket to stuff inside the pillow cover to get through the trip. Bought a little more expensive pillow with a twist inflating air valve.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Herzog

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking pillow at a franction of the price
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from 40 mile trip. Never had a backpacking pillow so went to box store to buy one. All of theres were $40 or more and i didnt want to spent that much. Checked amazon amd found this. Was very comfortable, easy to inflate, stayed inflated and was very light and packed small. Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Take a opinion from a frequent traveler.
customer_reviews.text: I fly alot with my husband being a flight attendant. This little pillow is great for the window seats ! I can also use it to sit on as well. Comes in a small bag (attached to the pillow) and folds up small ! I kept it blown up over night with no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Used this on the trek to Machu Picchu - perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow to use during my 4-day hike on the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu. It worked perfectly! It's comfy, light, soft, and packs nice and small. As a bonus, there's a head-shaped divot in the middle of the pillow that makes sleeping with earplugs super comfortable - even more so than most full-sized pillows. I still prefer to use my full-size pillow when I'm car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Fox

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow to use during a week long rafting trip in the Grand Canyon and found it to be exactly as advertised: easy to use, comfortable, and actually good-looking. I deflated it every morning for packing away in my sleep kit and re-inflating it at night was a piece of cake. I only returned it to its pouch at the end of my trip, and while that took a bit of time, I did finally get it to fold in. I would highly recommend this to anyone who needs a camp pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K

customer_reviews.title: Super Portable!
customer_reviews.text: This comes in such a portable package but I was surprised to see how big it gets once inflated. It only took 3-5 breaths and it was completely inflated. Has a durable seal and it's pretty comfortable. Good for a car ride, airplane ride, train ride, even for camping. Definitely my go to travel pillow now!
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: I just got It
customer_reviews.text: I know so far is it is lightweight enough for backpacking and comfortable enough for sleeping. We'll see how it lasts. The material is thin but hopefully durable. It does kind of smell like a beach ball.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzz

customer_reviews.title: Great so far...
customer_reviews.text: This has already saved my neck a quite a few times from flat hostel pillows! It's easy to inflate/deflate and pack for travel. I've had no issues so far. I am traveling for 10 weeks so I'll make sure I update after I'm back home. Update 8/6/2020: Just now realized I didn't update when I'd meant to. (Owned over a year now.) Anyway, extremely glad I packed this. In addition to saving my neck - I used it to sit on and save my tailbone on flights. I really appreciate how easy it is to adjust how much you've inflated it. And it never leaked at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: not reliable.  totally fail after 4 uses.
customer_reviews.text: used this pillow on and off for a year. maybe 5 times for 4 days backpacking. took it on the 6th time and it totally deflate in five minutes. i found a crack in the plastic. not a puncture. a crack. i patched but it still deflates in 3 hours of use. had another pillow before. a coccoon. was more expensive but lasted 4 years of heavy use. maybe 10 times for 4 day trips over 5 years. the plastic is super thin. thats why it fails. dont buy. wont last
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Schell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little pillow
customer_reviews.text: Love this pillow. Inflates with three full breaths and stays sealed all night. Very small, very lightweight, and I was (surprisingly) able to get it back into it's tiny little pouch without much trouble. That's more than I can say about most backpacking gear. Only downside I've noticed- the soft side that you pay your head on picks up hair very easily, so if you travel with a pet that sheds, you may want to bring along a travel-sized lint roller or something.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money; better products out there
customer_reviews.text: I took this product on a recent trip to Italy. It lasted about a week. Right now, it lasts overnight before it needs to be blown up again. So, if you need something overnight, it works. Otherwise, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Cochise

customer_reviews.title: This is what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Totally inflatable, not one of those "self inflating" jobs with weak foam inside that isn't strong enough to fully inflate the thing, but prevents you from packing it down really small. This is easily 1/2 to 1/3 the size of my former self-inflating pillow.
customer_reviews.author: PinstriperTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Inflatable pillow
customer_reviews.text: Love this inflatable pillow very easy to use and the video on how to store it back to its original location in the built in pouch is very HELPFUL thanks I would recommend this product 👍🏽.
customer_reviews.author: Rick G.

customer_reviews.title: Almost kept it
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this inflatable camping pillow 5 stars except the stopper is so hard to open when you want to deflate that even my husband took forever to get it open. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: meme

customer_reviews.title: Good for first use only
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these pillows for a backpacking trip in October of last year. We kept them with a container with the rest of our camping gear until our first camping trip in May. The inserts were completely cracked and therefore the pillows could not be used. The pillows were not wet and were neatly packed. Highly disappointed and would not recommend to another customer.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Henry

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good budget pillow
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a pretty good camp pillow. I like that the cover can be separated and washed. The inner inflatable part feels a little thin. Time will tell is that is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Z

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow!
customer_reviews.text: Great inflatable pillow. I've been using this a little over a week and it hasn't lost any air. It fits great over my chair and offers very nice support. It will also work great as a camping pillow. For the price you can't beat it. I'm very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: ty

customer_reviews.title: Company should fix the plastic cover where device is inflated and deflated
customer_reviews.text: It is very difficult to take the cover off where you inflate the device in order to deflate it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Malnak

customer_reviews.title: My travel buddy❤️
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my long flight to Europe and I am so happy that I did!!! I have a lower back issue and this help me a lot as my back support and pillow when I sit @ window side. The cover is soft and easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: smilequeen

customer_reviews.title: Hot or Miss on quality, beware!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 1 a while back and loved it. Bought a second one for a big trip. On night 2 one of them deflated slowly overnight and never held up again. The second one has been going strong. I am always gentle with my camping gear — I was on a month long camping trip and missed the return date unfortunately. Instead slept with a backpack for a pillow for weeks. Really I’m bummed because the one I kept is really comfy!
customer_reviews.author: Jess Benn

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to go camping. She raved about it! In her words: It was very easy to use, really comfortable, good size, very soft, and she loved the inner flap which keeps the air from escaping while you're inflating the pillow. She highly recommends.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Good, low profile for hammock camping.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to take with me on hikes and hammock camping and saw this as a low profile option. My backpack is quite limited in space as it is and a pillow for my hammock is a bit of a luxury item, but this inflatable pillow is a great addition that barely adds any extra weight to my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Careaga

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most products that have a pouch built in, this is surprisingly easy to fit back in its pouch. I can deflate it and get it back to about the size of a tennis ball. A few breaths will inflate it and it is actually contoured as opposed to one of the other camping pillows I have, which is basically a plastic bubble. This camping pillow has in indent in the center that makes it very comfortable to lay on. It has found a permanent home in my camping gear.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M Sorah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pillow as lumbar support in the helinox one camp chair. It provides just the right amount of cushion (since I can adjust it with less or more air) to allow me to sit forward. No air leakage, no issue deflating and restuffing is attached stuff sac (handy!). Love it!
customer_reviews.author: ZCG

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to use little pillow
customer_reviews.text: We love our camping pillows! They are super easy for travel and blow up quickly & easily/deflate easily. We use them mainly for camping, but have also taken on long flights. So much better than bundling up a blanket or sweatshirt!
customer_reviews.author: colormecolorado

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Broke after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Manufacturer sent me a replacement (thanks). I have learned to be exceedingly careful when opening the valve on this pillow. It nearly wants to break! Other than the valve, this pillow is awesome. Its really comfortable, packs small, and fits right into the top of my sleeping bag. It really makes for a better backpacking night sleep. Just mind the valve! Comfortable and good size pillow but the valve was faulty and the plastic seal ripped after just 2 uses. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: Tentmaker’s Telling Travel Testimony
customer_reviews.text: This hasn’t been Travel field tested but it looks like it will be an effective flight travel tray headrest and backup to ineffective overnight stay pillows that leave a lot to be desired. It has held air over several days of home testing and hopefully will become this backpacker’s dream of a restful nights sleep without a crick in the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Packs up small and STAYS inflated
customer_reviews.text: Obviously I got it out and tested it even though it is the dead of winter and so far from camping season...and it's so great! It stayed inflated for a week before I got around to deflating it myself (don't judge me). It's small, packable, and sturdy. The nozzle is very well made and will hold up. A+
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Extremely small hard to use
customer_reviews.text: its tiny tiny as in if your an adult laying on your side chances are your head will ha e to tilt down to touch it in my bad it is lost in head scoop and too small to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: carshop1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pillow!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pillow, folds down to practically nothing. Super lightweight. And wow, so comfortable! I think I may like it more than my normal bed pillows! Seriously though. Excellent pillow. I should have ordered two. One to put in between my legs cause I'm a sise sleeper. But it's comfortable on the back too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Oconnor

customer_reviews.title: Great support and portable
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great product however I think inflating it is the only downside to it. I find it hard to do without a pump. Otherwise it offers great support, super small and easy to travel with so I highly recommend it I just wish it was easier to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: artbyandiem

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for his backpack because this hardly takes up any room at all. It works great and my son loves it! He goes camping alot and now he sleeps in comfort! :)
customer_reviews.author: Billio

customer_reviews.title: As advertised and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 16 year old daughter for a glamping trip and flight. It was so quick and easy to inflate and uninflate. It was actually fun to do. It packs away to the size a bit thicker than a deck of cards. The only reason I marked comfort a 4 is it's a bit hard. We played with the amount of air in it and it was better. It will never be as comfy as a normal pillow, but it will be great for the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Cara DeGraff

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpacking Pillow
customer_reviews.text: This product is pretty dam comfortable at night and when inflated is plenty large enough to get good sleep. More importantly tough is how small and light (110g) this thing deflates to. Amazing product and at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: chasen

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow, light and compact
customer_reviews.text: Very light, compact with its own built in carrying case. I simply wrapped it up with my sleeping bag when stuffing it into the compression sack and it’s like it wasn’t even in my pack. My whole complaint is that it puts your neck at a slightly awkward angle but perhaps that’s just me being a picky sleeper. It serves its purpose wonderfully and will be coming with me on every backpacking/camping trip I go on
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy McNett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small plow up pillow to take on travel, movies, theater, and car. This is perfect. It is easy to blow up and neatly folds back up into a sewn in bag. I may need to order an extra one.
customer_reviews.author: currywolfe

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t knw something like this exists..
customer_reviews.text: So first thing first ... I didn’t knw that a collapsible pillow with pouch bag exists. Now for bag, i just tested for air didn’t find any leaks but was not able to fill it ... will give it a shot over weekend again . Like other people told it can’t be washed so need to be careful how dirty u make it ... I will recommend it for traveling ...
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every travel pillow made and this one didn't work either. Hard to blow up and not very sanitary. Does not contour to one's head.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff & Carol Olsen

customer_reviews.title: So soft and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Love how soft and comfortable this is! Only complaint is I wish it packed down a bit smaller for backpacking, but otherwise I’m in love!
customer_reviews.author: Jena

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a great lightweight pillow.
customer_reviews.text: Best lightweight pillow I have tried. The outside edges are 4.5 inches and the center is about three inches. But, for a broad shoulder adult sleeping on a 3 inch pad an inch thicker on the outside edges would be much better for sleeping on your side. Cotton cover is great. Weight is very light. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Extra pillows when traveling abroad
customer_reviews.text: When traveling outside the US, it’s nice to bring extra pillows. These compact, easy to inflate/deflate, soft camping pillows are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good value and packable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to inflate and packable. Not the easiest to fold back to be honest but that took a few trials folding it right to squeeze back into the built-in bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ken K.

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable camp pillow I own
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several inflatable pillows for camping but this one is by far the most comfortable. Very easy to store in my pack. Very good quality item. I have been very pleased with it and would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am a long-time inflatable pillow user, and have three brands now. RikkiTikki is the most comfortable under low inflation, which is my preference, because the valve is not easily felt.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Huffman

customer_reviews.title: I Think This Will Be Good
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to use this yet but I like how small it goes and I have blown it up to see what'll look like and seems nice 2 breath and it was blown up.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality... Hole in it, never got to use.
customer_reviews.text: Was the perfect pillow for backpacking... Inflated it once before going on a 4 day backpacking trip. 2nd inflation was first night after hiking 12 miles ... There was a HOLE duct tape wouldn't fix... Never got to use it 😟 if the quality was better it would get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: kate k.

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Best little pillow I’ve gotten in a while soft easy to inflate and deflate and fits in ur palm I bought it for camping and just took it for a three day hike super light and compact but I also used it in the car on the way home so it’s versatile great product
customer_reviews.author: Sean flynn

product_meta.title: RikkiTikki Inflatable Camping Pillow - Hiking Pillow Ultralight - Backpacking Pillow Lightweight - Camp Pillow Compressible - Blow Up Camping Pillow
feature_bullets: ✅ COMPACT and PORTABLE: the weight and size of inflatable travel pillow is well-balanced - it’s big enough (15 x 12 x 4.5 in ) for a comfortable sleep, yet it only weighs 4oz and won’t make your travel bag heavy.
✅ RELIABLE and EASY to USE: the camp pillow has a reliable valve, which doesn’t let the air escape. It’s is easy to use – you will be able to inflate the backpack pillow with just 3-4 deep breaths.
✅ COMPRESSIBLE and ULTRALIGHT: Fold the outdoor compressible blowup pillow into the bag sewn into it, as if it were a pair of socks. The folded hiking pillow looks like a tube the size of Coke can.
✅ MULTIFUNCTIONAL: it’s a great pillow for sleeping but not only — it can serve as inflatable back pillow for car or office chair.
✅LIFETIME GUARANTEE: We are sure of the quality of this great camp pillow for women and men and guarantee that you will like it -- or your money back!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
